elements.title: The Year in Physics
elements.contents: Puzzling particles, quirky (and controversial) quantum computers, and one of the most ambitious science experiments in history marked the year’s milestones.

elements.title: Detailed Footage Finally Reveals What Triggers Lightning
elements.contents: Scientists have never been able to adequately explain where lightning comes from. Now the first detailed observations of its emergence inside a cloud have exposed how electric fields grow strong enough to let bolts fly.

elements.title: Cosmologists Parry Attacks on the Vaunted Cosmological Principle
elements.contents: A central pillar of cosmology — the universe is the same everywhere and in all directions — is surviving a storm of possible evidence against it.

elements.title: Gravitational Waves Should Permanently Distort Space-Time
elements.contents: The “gravitational memory effect” predicts that a passing gravitational wave should forever alter the structure of space-time. Physicists have linked the phenomenon to fundamental cosmic symmetries and a potential solution to the black hole information paradox.
